rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative adjective modifying a risk-adjective.
The segment uses factual language without high-potency verbs or metaphors.
The segment does not contain a moderate verb paired with explicit scale or impact.
Segment does not contain a question.
The segment reports a fact/statistic but contains no explicit calming language.
'Only one case' has a minimiser but lacks explicit scale contrast.
The segment does not contain a bare negation.
The segment reports a case, not capabilities or preparedness.
'Only one case has been reported' reports a numerical metric (case count) factually.
